intro: Gisekia occulta, commonly known as the hidden gisekia, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its climbing habit and tendrils that allow it to attach to supports. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Its fruit is a small, round berry that ripens to a dark purple color. Due to its elusive nature and limited distribution, Gisekia occulta is of interest to botanists studying plant diversity and adaptation.
